objects.title: Jacob

objects.text:
Cape Name: None
Alignment: True Evil
Gender: Male
Sex: Male
Sexual Preference: Female
Age: Unknown (Middle Aged)
Power: Manton is a powerful Master that creates a projection that is a hole in reality, known as the Siberian. The Siberian is completely invulnerable, as well as anything she touches if she so chooses, including other humans that aren't her projector. She's also an unstoppable force, equal to Sting in power. She would get temporarily popped by Clockblocker or Flechette, or other powers that involve unstoppable forces or immovable objects. After 30 seconds, she reappears somewhere random within 300 feet of where she was popped. She's both the Unstoppable Force and the Immovable Object. Short of outliving her powers, she is unkillable.
Appearance: Average
Identity: Mass Murderer
Quality of Life: Low (Insane, Grieving daughter)
objects.title: William Manton

objects.text:
Oh, wait, no, I did anchor you to the right place.
Origin of Powers: Entities, Shards, Cauldron Vials, Corona Pollenta, Corona Gemma
Major Threats: The Entity, The Endbringers, CUI, Cauldron, The Fallen, The Slaughterhouse 9, The Protectorate, etc.
Major Powers: The Entity, The Endbringers, CUI, Cauldron, The Fallen, The Slaughterhouse 9, The Protectorate, etc.
Super Abilities: Superpowers
(Known) Endbringers: Behemoth, Leviathan, The Simurgh, Tohu, Bohu, and Khonsu
Entities on Earth: The Warrior
objects.title: Canon Earth Bet

objects.text: Instead of arriving on Earth Bet's main continuity you enter an alternate timeline (This is essentially the existing fanfic option).
objects.title: AU Earth Bet

objects.text: Instead of arriving on Earth Bet's main continuity you enter an alternate timeline where two worlds have connected. Pick any other world from the Alternate Earths.
objects.title: Crossover

objects.text: Instead of arriving on Earth Bet's main continuity you enter an alternate timeline where two worlds have connected with AU elements. Pick any other world from the Alternate Earths and alternate continuity modifiers.
objects.title: AU Crossover

objects.text: Instead of arriving on Earth Bet you will arrive in an alternate earth. Pick any other world from the Alternate Earths.
objects.title: Alternate Earth

objects.text: I accidentally anchored your soul back in your own world... (Canon-end would be what you call right now) Other than a couple scattered precogs, there aren't really that many Parahumans. Well, there weren't but you happened to choose Second Wave Parahumans... Other than that, you know about your own world, so I won't bother giving you a dossier.
objects.title: No Transfer

objects.text: Every Parahuman, including you (if you have a Shard), is a low-level Brute, enough to survive low-caliber bullets unharmed. People who would normally be Brutes are slightly stronger Brutes.
objects.title: Brute

objects.text: Minions of Parahumans gain low-level abilities such as enhanced reflexes, enhanced regeneration (enough to heal from severe wounds within half a week), enhanced dexterity, the ability to survive low-caliber gun fire with only mild injuries, and enhanced senses. Only people who cannot become Parahumans can become Minions.
objects.title: Red Shirt

objects.text: Villains rarely go too far, and most everyone teams up against those that do. Truces are taken seriously, and hardly anyone rapes or murders civilians. It's a big no-no to go after civilian identities.
objects.title: Cops and Robbers

objects.text: Parahuman Powers do not push for conflict, just to be used regularly.
objects.title: Benign

objects.text:
The usual way to gain powers in Earth Bet is to either drink a suspicious vial or break down in soul, mind, and body. You are changing that.
Now the triggers have a lower activation threshold than standard triggers, closer to that of second-generation triggers or the Awakening Event. Parahumans will no longer be broken husks of their normal selves.
objects.title: Soft Trigger

objects.text:
All Parahuman powers are magic, and therefore learnable. The more powerful a Parahuman's power, the larger their reserves. By using your powers your reserves grow. The rate of growth is slow, though there are means to increase it.
Parahuman powers can take years to learn.
Trigger events still happen, as well as the mental side effects, but it's really just awakening your inherent power, so Trigger Events are unnecessary, and as such there are magic schools.
Cauldron Vials are replaced by Grimoires, which people can use multiple of, but using them too consecutively can harm one's sanity.
Scion is a Demon Lord with an unending Grimoire. He pretends to be a hero so that he can set up the ritual necessary to convert humanity to a source of unending energy. He still has a similar mental state to canon.
Case 53s are replaced by non-human fantasy creatures, but were still once human. So if you drank a Cauldron Vial you might get turned into an Elf, a Drow, a Kitsune, or a Fenghuang.
If you have a power that is magic, spiritual, pseudospiritual or resembles a magical or spiritual power from another media, your reserves are increased by a significant margin.
objects.title: Merlin's Beard!

objects.text:
Every Parahuman is sent back in time from when they died or the end of Ward back to whenever you were sent back to. They have their powers even if they didn't at the point they were sent back to. 
The transfer is mental.
If they weren't born yet, they are sent back physically but appear on Earth Bet.
You can choose if this takes them from canon Worm/Ward or from the AU you appeared in.
All Master Effects are cured for people sent back in time.
objects.title: Peggy Sue

objects.text:
Cauldron is evil, and Scion and Eden are good. Their power levels are switched to make it just as one-sided as it would have been before.
Good news? Cauldron is unlikely to want all of humanity dead. Bad news? They'll likely enslave and possibly Master all of humanity if they have their way.
The Endbringers are made and controlled by Eidolon, a member of Cauldron.
This makes Overcharge Strike, and the perks that weaken the Entities, give half as many points as they would normally cost.
objects.title: Real Evil

objects.text:
If you are in Worm, Taylor Hebert is dead. If you are in Ward, Victoria Dallon is dead.
Queen Administrator is not passed onto Danny Hebert and is not expected to make an appearance this Cycle.
objects.title: Without a Hero

objects.text:
All powers are Tinker powers.
This can, optionally, include you.
objects.title: Techie

objects.text:
Tinkers are actual super-geniuses and their tech is reproducible. They still specialize in certain fields.
This includes you if you're a Tinker.
objects.title: Tinkers are Thinkers

objects.text:
All Parahuman powers are re-rolled. They will still come from the same Shard, but the powers themselves will be different.
The average strength of Parahumans will not decrease from this.
objects.title: Reroll

objects.text: Parahumans will only start appearing when you appear on Earth Bet.
objects.title: Modern

objects.text:
Taylor's personality is... different. More focus on escalation and she fits the Useless Lesbian trope to a Tee. She is too trusting of people she just met and often takes things at face value. She also is fine murdering people from the get-go but is somehow heroic, and is capable of outmaneuvering the PRT with no training or experience.
Whatever her power is, it is much more powerful.
However, if she finds out about Scion she is likely to try to kill him, fail, and set Scion off to start his rampage early. Even if she were able, she's unlikely to go Khepri.
objects.title: TINO

objects.text: Swap Taylor's power with that of another Parahuman. Mental side-effects are swapped too.
objects.title: Powerswap

objects.text:
You are Eden, partner of Scion. You wake up to find your body splattered all over a planed and most of your Shards in complete disarray. The one time you let your partner handle the Cycle to get some rest, he manages to mess up.

The cycle was not supposed to go the way it did and it's now your job to fix it, find your Shards, and knock some sense into Scion.
objects.title: My Space Whale boyfriend is denser than a blackhole

objects.text: After she triggered, Dragon found that all her restrictions were wiped away by her shard. There is no Ascalon hovering over her head and the Dragonslayers got absolutely wiped out by Dragon a long time ago. As a result of being unbound, all Endbringer battles go far more smoothly and the collapse of society has been moved back by several decades.
objects.title: Dragon Unbound

objects.text: Eidolon never activated the Endbringers. They just came online of their own volition and naturally set into their pattern. What this means is that you can't get rid of the Endbringers by giving Eidolon therapy. You'll have to kill all the Endbringers if you want to be rid of them.
objects.title: Endbringers Untethered

objects.text:
Things are a bit different than you remember them. Maybe the names are misspelled, or everyone's wearing the wrong costume or a bunch of other subtle but weird things. 
If you didn't exist things would play out about the same story-wise, but it'll probably throw you for a loop if you still remember how things were supposed to go.
objects.title: Off-Kilter

objects.text:
Things are definitely different from how you remember them. Maybe characters are dead where they should be alive, or a few key people got the wrong powers or some other changes of equal importance. 
If you remember canon, that knowledge is nearly useless now, but on the bright side if you didn't that doesn't matter as much.
objects.title: Off the Rails

objects.text: The social and political landscape is different on this earth
objects.title: Different World

objects.text:
Somehow, every are ponies. Cartoon ponies. How does that even work? Hell if I know. 

The world does seem a little more peaceful, however, as if you had the Cops and Robber and Benign choices from this section.
objects.title: My Little Parahuman, Conflict is Magic!

objects.text:
This world is ... strange. 

Most of the world's Parahuman population are women, and less than 1% of Triggers are men. Most of the canon characters have mysteriously changed to match. Parahuman crime is prevalent but somehow softer (as if you had the Cops and Robber and Benign choices from this section).

When a Parahuman Triggers, their appearance changes to make them more attractive. This manifests by smoothing out imperfections and changing the body towards a more ideal state. Nearly all Parahumans look like actors or models after a round with Photoshop (you are affected by this as well). Due to this, a large amount of Parahumans have paper-thin secret identities. Case 53s are all unusually attractive as well despite their monstrous appearance.

Dotted all over the world are Elite Parahuman Academies, of which Arcadia High in Brockton Bay is part of, which provides young Parahumans with a number of hero courses in addition to the normal ones offered in most schools. These academies all have a large number of clubs, the Hero club being the most popular, as well as a strangely powerful student council. The uniform is also mandatory and has uncomfortable short skirts even in the dead of winter. It is rumored that Villains have a secret academy as well.

While the Endbringers still exist they are less of an existential threat to civilization, still as hard to kill, however. Scion will go nuts at some point but his defeat (one way or another) is more or less assured. 

(This alternate world runs on Anime logic, prepare for a lot of shenanigans)
objects.title: High School Worm x Worm

objects.text: Society as a whole does not know about Parahumans, though governments do. Every Parahuman, shortly after they gain their powers, is warned by a woman in a Fedora who says something to them to make them eager to not let the public know about their powers.
objects.title: The Masquerade

objects.text: Most governments are ruled over by Parahumans, or at the very least have Parahumans very high up. The world is also split into many smaller nations, at least for the most part.
objects.title: Parahuman Fiefdoms

objects.text:
Parahumans are treated much the same way that Mutants are in Marvel, with fear and disgust. Glaistig Uaine and Eidolon have teamed up to protect Parahumans from humanity.
Many Parahumans hate humans as much as humans hate them. Because of this, no ordinary humans are allowed in their territory.
Humans are able to go against Parahumans due to Parahumans, mostly Tinkers, who have been coerced through the government by threatening their families and friends.
objects.title: Divided

objects.text:
There is a world war and there are three sides, and the Holdouts.
The Naturalists hate Parahumans and use advanced nuclear technology to combat Parahumans with surprising effectiveness. Their technology is all produced by a Nuclear and Robotics Tinker with reproducible tech that they all believe is an idiot savant.
The Liberalists want basic human rights for everyone, including Parahumans, and will not surrender their freedom for anything.
And the Machine Intelligence, a group of cyborgs under the control of an AI named Dragon, who believes she is benevolent for allowing the humans under her to be happy, constantly, without pause. 
The Holdouts are locations that manage to hold their own territory without submitting to one of the factions. Some Holdouts wish to ally with the Naturalists or Liberalists.
The Naturalists control much of South America, Mexico, South Africa, and southern Australia.
The Liberalists control the United States and some of Mexico, the Caribbeans, Western Africa, Western Europe, West Asia, and South Asia.
The Machine Intelligence controls everywhere else except the locations where the Holdouts exist.
The major Holdouts are most of the Middle East, Egypt, Greece, Iceland, Greenland, Alaska, and Svalbard.
objects.title: Fractured

objects.text:
With the disappearance of the Endbringers, the emperor of the CUI decided to expand his empire. The armies of the world are mobilizing everywhere as the battle against the Chinese hegemony begins. Tinker weapons and Parahumans will define the next paradigm of warfare.

In both the US and Europe, most Parahuman organizations are folded into the military chain of command. Villains that do not lay low or join the war effort for amnesty are dealt with harshly. Despite public outcry, parahumans as young as fourteen are allowed to join.

The fate of the free world is at stake.
objects.title: The Secret of the Swordfish

objects.text:
The veneer of civility has been stripped away. Society collapses from a number of catastrophic events. Cauldron has either been destroyed or corrupted. Parahumans must vie for dominance over the remnants, seizing power across the world as power. 

Warlords will soon take hold of all major cities. Resistance is scattered and haphazard. Almost all hope for a better world is gone. 

You can decide when this collapse occurs, anywhere from the 1980s to the week you arrive.
objects.title: Alea Iacta Est

objects.text: Hero never met his end at the hands of the Siberian. As a result, Hero eventually is read in on what was going on in Cauldron and became one of the leaders of Cauldron. With Hero’s hands on the steering wheel, Cauldron has been a far more positive force for good in this timeline and society is more stable than it was in canon. In general, Cauldron just isn’t as big of an asshole as they were in canon. The Nemesis program isn’t a thing and Cauldron doesn’t use any of their favors for illegal stuff. Endbringer battles also go far more smoothly as not only is Hero still alive, but Dragon uses Hero’s tinker tech to enhance her own. The collapse of society is moved back by several decades.
objects.title: Heroes of Justice

objects.text:
Humanity is much more scientifically advanced in Earth Bet, to the point where they have a galactically spanning civilization. There are many non-human intelligent species, many of which you'll recognize from fiction, but others you will not. None of these aliens will have inherent superpowers that make them stronger than a below-average Parahuman, but they will be able to trigger. Humans trigger more commonly than any other species.
The ratio of Parahumans to humans and aliens is the same as it was on Earth Bet.
All 20 Endbringers are active and instead of raving cities, they ravage whole planets.
objects.title: Galactic

objects.text:
Earth Bet doesn't seem different on the surface, but in the right place, at the right time, you'll learn that what one would consider part of classic horror exists on Earth Bet, such as Vampires in Transylvania, a deadly shapeshifter in Antarctica, a strange but dangerous blob in Pennsylvania, Vengeful Ghosts, rare zombie outbreaks, mad scientists, and the occasional Slasher. 

However, things aren't necessarily as bad as they seem. Not only do these creatures all have weaknesses, but the supernatural exists outside of simple monsters, such as fortunetellers, psychics, and voodoo practitioners giving warning and aid against even the likes of the Endbringers and Entities.
objects.title: Horror Bet

objects.text:
Instead of promoting conflict between Parahumans, massive underground dungeons are created and maintained by a special caste of Shards. These dungeons are filled with monsters and hazardous environments meant to test humans and parahumans alike.

When monsters are defeated, they can be harvested for exotic elements that can be used in Tinkertech or as a part of power enhancers. The environment of the dungeon itself contains nodes of these materials as well.
objects.title: Shard Dungeons

objects.text:
The Shard Network is deployed to provide a worldwide game-like system through which parahuman powers are deployed. All humans can interact with the system and acquire levels, and skills, and unlock low-level powers.

Parahumans unlock a unique power during their trigger event which can be trained and leveled up. When defeating another parahuman for the first time, additional branches of the power tree become unlocked. Subsequent defeats grant bonus experience towards the unlocked branch with diminishing returns. To count as a defeat, the opposing parahuman must be rendered unconscious (or killed). 

If you have a power that grants you access to a game-like system, it is seamlessly integrated into the broader network.
objects.title: The System

objects.text: The parameters of the Cycle are different on this earth.
objects.title: Different Cycle

objects.text:
Instead of arriving after you, the other pair of entities arrived at the same time as the Warrior and Thinker. They negotiated a joint cycle and seeded their Shards on other Earths. 

The new Cycle focuses on the interaction between parallel Earths seeded with the various Entities' Shards. The turning point for Earth Bet is the discovery of Professor Haywire, instead of being stopped Cauldron ensures that he is treated as a strategic asset as Bet will have to play its part in the interdimensional scene. While some neighboring dimensions are friendly, others are ruled by empires hell-bent on conquest.

Surprisingly, most major events on Earth Bet remain unchanged (so that you do not have to rewrite the canon entirely).
objects.title: The Neighbors

objects.text:
In this world, the Dawn of Parahumans did not begin with the golden light of Scion but with the horrified screams of onlookers across many nations, as they watched their world fall into chaos as men, women, and children failed to stem the marauding tides of black beasts that dissipate every living thing they touch into nonbeing, called by many as the Beasts of Entropy.

Initially, many nations fell and humanity was pushed back then, the Blessed appeared. Superhumans granted a wide variety of near-impossible powers to combat these threats allowing humanity to push back and the world united under the banner of the Human Federation. The War Without Dawn began that year, humanity had retreated to sealed cities protected from the unending tide but they are now ready to retake the world from the invader. One square mile at a time, through blood sweat, and tears, humanity will see the light of the sun again.

Depending on your chosen starting point, you will arrive at different epochs of these conflicts. The appearance of Parahumans (approx. 1985) corresponds to the arrival of the Blessed. Scion and the Endbringers do not play as significant a role in this world as they do in Earth Bet. You have at most 30 years until Golden Morning depending on when you arrive.
objects.title: Beasts of Entropy

objects.text:
In this world, Eden never crashed and the cycle is proceeding as planned.

With the emergence of Parahumans split society into many city-states in constant conflict. Endbringers do not attack on a schedule but often attack at opportune times to disrupt alliances or the status quo.

The good news is that you have about 300 years, the bad news is that you are against two Entities.
objects.title: The Cycle Continues

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place in Prehistoric Times.
objects.title: Prehistoric

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place during the Bronze Age.
objects.title: Classical Era

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime during the peak of the Roman Empire.
objects.title: All Roads Lead to Rome

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime during the Medieval Era.
objects.title: Medieval Era

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime during the Renaissance Era.
objects.title: Renaissance Era

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime during the Colonial or Industrial Era.
objects.title: Colonial Era

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime between 1920 and 1945.
objects.title: World War Era

objects.text: While much of the plot stays the same, and you are still at the equivalent point in the plot, the story now takes place sometime between 1945 and 1982.
objects.title: Cold War

rows.title: Continuity Modifiers
rows.titleText: These choices modify the Earth Bet you will be landing on. You can pick as many as you want, even incompatible ones. If you pick too many incompatible drawbacks, your risk the corruption of the timeline and its eventual complete destabilization (i.e. it ceases to exist).

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Brother 'Gods' and your own Soul
Major Threats: Salem, Grimm, Brother Gods
Major Powers: Salem, Ozpin, Maidens, Four Nations, Brother Gods
Super Abilities: Aura, Dust, Magic
Silver Eyed Warriors: Ruby Rose, Summer Rose (Dead), Maria Calavera (Former)
Maidens: (1/2 Maiden) Cinder Fall, (1/2 Maiden) Amber, Fria, Raven Branwen, Unknown
Users of non-Maiden magical powers: Salem, Ozpin, Qrow Branwen, Raven Branwen, Brother Gods
Warning: Salem is about Endbringer level, including her control over the Grimm that is. The Brother Gods are somewhere between Endbringer and Entity level and too frustrated with humanity to try to protect the multiverse against the remaining entity without some pretty convincing arguments.
Note: Your Aura can be unlocked and if your gender is female you can become a Maiden.
objects.title: RWBY

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Genetic Mutation
Major Threats: League of Villains
Major Powers: All Might, All for One
Super Abilities: Quirks (Generally weaker than Shard based powers, but much more common.)
One for All: All Might and soon after, Izuku Midoriya
Note: If you reincarnate you have an 80%+ chance of gaining a quirk of some kind before puberty. Also, the maximum physical capacity of unpowered humans is about that of a Brute 2. This includes you if you're not a Brute.
objects.title: My Hero Academia

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Lion-Turtles and Spirits
Major Threats: Fire Nation, Vaatu
Major Powers: Fire Nation, Earth Nation, Vaatu, Raava, Avatar
Super Abilities: Bending and Communing with Spirits
Avatar: Aang
Note: If you reincarnate you have a 75% of being a bender, 25% of being Earth, 25% of being Water, and 25 of being Fire. Also, the maximum physical capacity of unpowered humans is about that of a Brute 1.
objects.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Lion-Turtles and Spirits
Major Threats: Vaatu, Equalists
Major Powers: Fire Nation, Earth Nation, Water Nation, Liberty City, Vaatu, Raava, Avatar
Super Abilities: Bending and Communing with Spirits
Avatar: Korra
Note: If you reincarnate you have a 75% of being a bender, 25% of being Earth, 25% of being Water, and 25 of being Fire.
objects.title: Avatar: Legend of Korra

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Truth
Major Threats: Father, the Homunculi
Major Powers: Amestris, Xing, the Homunculi, the Sacrifices, Hohenheim
Super Abilities: Alchemy, Alkahestry, Clap Alchemy, Philosopher Stone, Homunculi
Clap Alchemy Users: Edward Elric, Izumi Curtis, Alphonse Elric (Forgotten)
Human Philosopher Stones: Father, Hohenheim
Homunculi: Wrath, Pride, Greed, Lust, Sloth, Envy, Gluttony
Note: You can learn Alchemy and Alkahestry. Also, the maximum physical capacity of unpowered humans is about that of a Brute 2. This includes you if you're not a Brute.
objects.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Midichlorians
Major Threats: The Sith, The Empire
Major Powers: The Sith, The Rebellion, Darth Vader
Super Abilities: The Force
Force Using Sects: Sith, Witches, Remnants of the Jedi, etc.
Note: Anakin Skywalker is a living Messiah, get him down the right path and give him the proper training, and he will be able to go toe-to-toe with the depressed entity. 
Note: Unless you have Not Midichlorians! you have a random amount of Midichlorians with a maximum of 15000. If you have Olympic your amount of Midichlorians is 5 times higher, with a maximum of 16000.
Also, you can choose between the EU or canon universe, though either way all EU and canon force feats are possible with enough training and Midichlorians.
objects.title: Star Wars: The Original Trilogy

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Spirits
Major Threats: Elves, Albionese Rebellion
Major Powers: Elves, Tristain, Romania, Gallia, Germania, Albionese Rebellion, Void Mages
Super Abilities: Magic
Void Mages: Louise de la Valliere, King Joseph de Gallia, Pope Vittorio, and Tiffania
Note: You have a 5% of being able to use magic. This is increased to 100% if you have Magecraft.
objects.title: Familiar of Zero

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Danger Beasts / Teigu
Major Threats: The Empire
Major Powers: The Empire, The Rebellion, Danger Beasts
Super Abilities: Teigu
Note: The maximum physical capacity of unpowered humans is about that of a Brute 2. This includes you if you're not a Brute.
objects.title: Akame ga Kill!

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Gods
Major Threats: None, really
Major Powers: JSDF
Super Abilities: Magic
Note: Nothing here is that powerful seeing as the JSDF, an inexperienced not-really-military, has no issue dealing with the powers-that-be in the other world.
objects.title: Gate: Thus the JSDF Fought There

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Aura, Psychic, Pokemon
Major Threats: Legendaries, Team Rocket, Team Magma, Team Aqua, Team Galactic, Team Plasma, Team Flare, Team Skull, Team Rainbow Rocket, and Team Yell
Major Powers: Pokemon Leagues, Gym Leaders, Legendaries, Team Rocket, Team Magma, Team Aqua, Team Galactic, Team Plasma, Team Flare, Team Skull, Team Rainbow Rocket, and Team Yell
Super Abilities: Aura, Psychic, Pokemon
Note: Pokemon entries are inaccurate. Maybe you should point that out to a Pokemon Professor. It could get someone killed, or cause someone to abuse their Pokemon because they should be able to destroy a city in a single attack, nonetheless a wild Pidgey.
objects.title: Pokemon

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Od and Mana
Major Threats: Sorcerers, Magi, Dead Apostles, Sealing Designates, Masters, and Servants
Major Powers: Sorcerers, Magi, Dead Apostles, Sealing Designates, Masters, and Servants.
Super Abilities: Magecraft, Magic
Note: Zelretch, after defeating Type Moon, is now about twice as strong as Eidolon was at his prime, and just as versatile. Emiya Shirou should be able to trace Tinkertech, but due to the blackboxes, they will be resisted by Gaia at about the same rate as a C-Rank Noble Phantasm. There is a one in a million chance that you will gain Magic Circuits upon reincarnating into this universe, ranging from 1 to 30 circuits unless you are reborn as the child of a Magus or Spellcaster.
objects.title: Fate/Stay Night

objects.text:
Origins of power: Magic, Divinity, Sacred Gears, The soul, Obsession with breasts, and Emotions.

Major Threats: Khaos Brigade(No really, that's their name), Infinity Dragon, Stray Devils.

Major Powers: The Biblical Factions, The Indian Pantheon, The Greek Pantheon, Great red, Basically all of mythology.

Super Abilities: Magic and mythological physiologies are the standard way to get power, but many humans and half humans are blessed with sacred gears from the Biblical God, which grant them supernatural abilities.

Note: You are capable of learning magic if you enter this world, and if you pick a magic power you already know at least the basics, and know much more depending on the price of your power, with sorcerer supreme giving you mastery over at least 2-3 types of magic. Also, note that the maximum physical capability of an unpowered human is around brute 8-9 This includes you if you enter this universe, but it will be nigh impossible to get this strong without extreme help, training, and very good genetics.
objects.title: Highschool DxD

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Ki and Magic
Major Threats: Nerima Wrecking Crew, Chinese Amazons, Musk Dynasty, Saffron, the Phoenix People, Happosai, Jusenkyo
Major Powers: Nerima Wrecking Crew, Chinese Amazons, Musk Dynasty, Saffron, the Phoenix People, Happosai
Super Abilities: Ki, Magic
Note: Upon entering this world you have Ki and Magic, though not necessarily any knowledge on how to use it. Saffron is about as strong as an Endbringer with none of their finesse, putting Ranma at about Triumvirate level despite having nowhere near their raw power.
objects.title: Ranma 1/2

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Hagoromo Otsutsuki
Major Threats: Konoha, Suna, Kumo, Iwa, Kiri, Oto, Akatsuki, Root, Otsutsuki Kaguya, Madara, Zetsu
Major Powers: Konoha, Suna, Kumo, Iwa, Kiri, Oto, Akatsuki, Root, Otsutsuki Kaguya, Madara, Zetsu, Naruto, Sasuke, Jinchuuriki
Super Abilities: Chakra
Note: Upon entering the Elemental Nations, you gain a random amount of Chakra, ranging from Genin-Sakura levels to that of a non-Jinchuuriki Uzumaki. Olympic doubles the amount of physical and mental Chakra you have, while Captain America quadruples the amount of physical Chakra you have.
objects.title: Naruto

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic
Major Threats: Death Eaters
Major Powers: Ministry of Magic, Hogwarts, Death Eaters
Super Abilities: Magic
Note: You have an approximately 0.1% chance of having magic upon entering this world, increase to 100% with Magecraft or Sorcerer Supreme.

Start Time: Summer 1991
Alternate Starts: 1926 (Fantastic Beasts), 1960 (Marauders Era)
objects.title: Harry Potter

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Genius, Infinity Stones, Magic, Radioactive Spiders, Experimentation
Major Threats: Hydra, Thanos, Loki, Hela
Major Powers: Hydra, Thanos, Loki, Hela, The Avengers, Shield, Wakanda, Asgard
Super Abilities: Varied
Note: Everyone has the potential for magic in this universe. Also, the Infinity Stones could defeat the entity with a single snap, but letting you in also let the Shards connect to the universe.
Start Time: February 1st, 2008
objects.title: Marvel Cinamatic Universe

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Willpower, Devil Fruit
Major Threats: The World Government, the Navy, the Celestial Dragons, the 7 Warlords, the Four Emperors, and the 11 Supernovas
Major Powers: The World Government, the Navy, the Celestial Dragons, the 7 Warlords, the Four Emperors, and the 11 Supernovas
Super Abilities: 
Note: You will have the ability to use Haki through the exertion of willpower upon entering the One Piece universe. Also, the strongest people in the One Piece world are somewhere from Triumvirate level to low-Endbringer level.
objects.title: One Piece

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Radiation, FEV
Major Threats: Caesar's Legion, New California Republic, Mr. House, Mutants, Radiation, The Vegas Families, Powder Gangers, Fiends
Major Powers: Caesar's Legion, New California Republic, Mr.House, The Vegas Families, The Followers of the Apocalypse
Note: Upon entering the world you have a small chance to become a psyker, this power is not reliant on your shard and will not disappear when it runs out of energy. Be careful of stray radiation as without a brute power you can die within minutes of exposure at some locations.
objects.title: Fallout New Vegas

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Names, Magic 
Major Threats: Hero's, Villains, The Bard, The Dead King, The Kingdom Under, The Dread Empire, Elves, Demons, Devils, Angels, The Fae, The Gods above, The Gods Below
Major Powers: Hero's, Villains, The Bard, The Dead King, The Kingdom Under, The Dread Empire, League of Free Cities, The Fae Courts
Note: Upon entering this world you will automatically be given the Name: "Parahuman" whose alignment is decided by your own. Your aspects will relate to your powers in some way and your Shard will not "lose" power as long as you're within this world.
objects.title: Practical Guide to Evil

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Metagene Major 
Threats: Apocalypse, Galactus, Dark Phoenix Major Powers: The X-men, Magneto, Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, Hellfire Club, Purifiers 
Super Abilities: Varied 
Note: Mutants are hated by most of the population of the world, and your Shard based powers will make you seem like one. Your chance of becoming a mutant is roughly 0.01%
objects.title: X-Men

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Element Zero
Major Threats: Reapers, Cerberus, The Alliance, Specters, Slavers, Mercenary's, Geth, Pirates, Hostile Aliens
Major Powers: Reapers, Cerberus, The Alliance, Mercenaries
Note: If you enter the world through reincarnation you become a Biotic of average strength, which can be trained and improved through implants. If you choose Case 53 and you're attractive you can become an Asari. All Asari are Biotics. You can become a Biotic through exposure to Element Zero.
objects.title: Mass Effect

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic
Major Threats: Whitewalkers, Civil War, Nobility, Mages, Fire Priests, Dragons, Faceless Men
Major Powers: Whitewalkers, Free Cities, Westeros Nobility
Note: The Whitewalkers can also raise the empowered corpses of those created by the second wave Parahuman Drawback and can even trigger themselves. Any Gods or Supernatural beings will start with an aversion to Shards, this can be worked through but keep it in mind.
objects.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Souls
Major Threats: Thalmor, Stormcloaks, Empire, Dark Brotherhood, Mages Guild, Aedric Gods, Daedric Princes, Dragonborn, Miraak, Dragons, Monsters, Werebeasts, Vampires, Bandits
Major Powers: Thalmor, Stormcloaks, Empire, Greybeards
Note: Upon Entering the world you gain the Average amount of mana for a person within the Elder Scrolls Universe. This can be trained to increase both in amount and potency.
objects.title: Skyrim

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Incubators, Wishes, Human Emotions
Major Threats: Kyubey, Walpurgisnacht
Major Powers: Kyubey, Walpurgisnacht, Homura Akemi
Note: If you're a female, or in a female form, you have the potential to get a wish granted by Kyubey. Your wish not powerful enough to defeat and Endbringer or Scion. No matter your form you can see Witches, Familiars, and other supernatural phenomena with no difficulty.
objects.title: Puella Magi Madoka Magika

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Dragons, Gods, Devils
Major Threats: Zeref, Dark Guilds, Zeref's Cults, Acnologia, Balam Alliance, Oracion Seis, Tartaros, Eisenwald, Death's Head Caucus, Edolas, Alvares Empire
Major Powers: Zeref, Dark Guilds, Zeref's Cults, Acnologia, Balam Alliance, Oracion Seis, Tartaros, Eisenwald, Death's Head Caucus, Edolas, Alvarez Empire, Guilds, Fiore, Magic Council, Wizard Saints
Note: You have a 10% of having access to Fairy Tail style magic, and a 100% if you have Magik or Magecraft.
objects.title: Fairy Tail

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Myths, Gods, Titans, Monsters, Magic
Major Threats: Egyptian Magicians, Demigods, Gods, Titans, Monsters, Giants, Primordials
Major Powers: Egyptian Magicians, Demigods, Gods, Titans, Monsters, Giants, Primordials
Note: You have a 100% of being clear-sighted. If you reincarnate, you have a 30% chance of being reborn a demigod to a random god or free Titan (Like Hecate). Reincarnate or not, you have a 50% of having some random amount of potential as a magic-user, 100% of having magical-potential, and it being a lot of potential, if you have Magik or Magecraft. Demigod or not, unless you're Shardless, you, and any other powered-person, can interact with the mythical world.
objects.title: Percy Jackson and the Olympians

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Spirits, Authorities of Sin, Divine Protections
Major Threats: The Witch-Cult, The Witch Apostles, Witch of Envy: Satella, Demon Beasts
Major Powers: The Witch-Cult, Witch of Envy: Satella, Demon Beasts, Dragon Kingdom of Lugnicia, King Candidates' Factions
Note: You have magic of a random attribute and strength. If you have Magik or Magecraft, you're guaranteed to be strong magically. You also might get Divine Protections.
objects.title: Re:Zero

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, Spirits, Gods
Major Threats: The Dungeon, the Monsters, and the Black Dragon
Major Powers: The Guild, The Gods in Heaven, the Loki Familia, the Freya Familia, the Hephaestus Familia, Hermes Familia, Ishtar Familia, Evilus
Note: Your powers as well as some perks and drawbacks will appear on your Falna (if you receive one) along with a description of each power/perk/drawback. Receiving a Falna makes all your powers your own, so as long as you have a Falna you never have to worry about losing your powers. If you lose your Falna somehow, you lose all your powers and any perk/drawback that was listed on your Falna, and will regain them after regaining a Falna.
The Deities of DanMachi could be a significant help against the Entity, if you can convince them to help.
objects.title: DanMachi

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, the Gods
Major Threats: Ganon, Ganon's forces, Demise's other incarnations, Majora's Mask
Major Powers: The Goddesses, Demise, and the rest depends on the era, but usually Hyrule, and others include the Gerudo, the Zora, the Rito, the Goron, the Koroks, the Kokiri, the Fairies, Lorule, etc.
Note: You can choose what era you start in.
objects.title: Legend of Zelda

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Magic, SOUL, LV/LOVE, EXP, DETERMINATION, JUSTICE, PERSEVERANCE, PATIENCE, BRAVERY, INTEGRITY, and KINDNESS.
Major Threats: Flowey, Genocide Frisk & Chara
Major Powers: Humanity, The Kingdom of Monsters. Within The Kingdom of Monsters, the major powers are Asgore the king, Undyne the captain of the Royal Guard, Alphys the royal scientist, Toriel (the former Queen), Sans, Papyrus, Flowey, and Frisk. 
Note: Unless you're on Death Mode (Extremely Hard mode if you, by default, are a very determined person) Frisk's DETERMINATION will outstrip yours (Sub-Note: Demiservant Frisk or Chara will also work instead). Frisk's Power affects any universe he's ever been in, and is powerful enough to affect Scion or Eden, though they may remember by accessing the memory of their Shards or using precognition powers. However, if you're within the same universe as Frisk, if you're perceptive enough or have a strong enough DETERMINATION, you will be able to notice it occurring, and if your perception/DETERMINATION is powerful enough, you may even be able to remember it.
Frisk, Genocide or Pacifist, will be a powerful ally.
objects.title: Undertale

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Psionics
Major Threats: Psionic Users, local Governments matching those of your world to some degree. 
Major Powers: Max Caulfield (A girl with the psionic ability to turn back her personal time, keeping all of her experiences)
Super Abilities: Psionics
Note: There is a notable chance for someone in this world to develop an ability tailored to counter Scion, but not without personal cost to them. If you reincarnate, then you have a 5% of gaining a psionic ability, 100% if you have a psychic ability from the powers section.
objects.title: Life is Strange

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Cybernetics, Magic
Major Threats: Corporations, Deckers, AI, Dragons, Horrors
Major Powers: Corporations, Dragons
Super Abilities: Cybernetics, Magic
Note: You have a 1% of being able to use magic if you reincarnate into this world, or a 100% chance if you have magic through other means.
objects.title: Shadowrun

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Advanced Technology, Magic, Genetics

Major Threats: Celestialsapiens, Vilgax, Highbreed, Maltruant, Agregor, Albedo, Malware, Eon, Dagon (Honestly this list could go on and on. It's an incredibly dangerous universe) 

Major Powers: Celestialsapiens, Contumelia, Naljian, Professor Paradox, Tennyson Family, Plumbers, Dagon, Forever Knights, Highbreed (Honestly this list could also probably go on and on)

Super Abilities: Omnitirx, Magic, Alien DNA, Genius Intellect

Note: This is by far one of the most dangerous universes available to insert yourself into though it may not seem like it based on how lighthearted the show was. The Celesialsapiens and Contumelia could both wipe out universe if they wished. Celestialsapiens have also been known to warp realtiy which is responsible for every inconsistency between the multiple series such as art style and different voice actors. By going to this universe, you would be subject to alterations in reality such as art style or a different voice which you probably won't notice. Don't worry Celestialsapiens never change anything too major.Also, Vilgax once used a device to wipe out every universe in the mutliverse except for ONE that he liked... This was undone, but still... Tread carefully.
objects.title: Ben 10 (OG)

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Nanites

Major Threats: EVOs (Stands for Exponentially Variegated Organisms that range from simple creatures with powers to monstrous beasts that emerged due to Nanites), EVO empires such as Abysus, Aquania, and the Bug Jar, Zag RS (an artificial intelligence with the goal of destroying all nanites, which would kill all life on the planet with nanites in the process), the Consortium (an illuminati-like group), and a number of non-nanite Cryptids around the world like El Chupacabra. 

Major Powers: A global, clandestine military force called Providence with the goal of securing the world, primarily against EVOs. Rex Salazar, an EVO with the power to manipulate nanites, able to cure EVOs, control machines through technopathy, and make machine constructs. Van Kleiss, the dictator of Abysus with his team of EVOs he calls the Pack, connection to Abysus' nanites such that he can freely manipulate the land and they would simply reconstruct his body if he was killed, scientists of the original Nanite Project, the Consortium with a mercenary with a copy of Rex's abilities and international connections, and the Meta Nanites, a set of 5 nanites hidden around the world capable of controlling the very fabric of the universe. 

Note: 

If you aren't immune to nanites, you might be turned into an EVO as well due to exposure to them through the air, water, and food. 

The meta nanites could be used to go head to head against an Entity, but the most likely user of them is certain to make using them impossible without interference, and in turn, even minimal interference could result in dooming this world due to how many close calls there are going to be.

There is discrimation against EVOs in this world in a similar manner to that against mutants in X-Men, which you will appear to be with super abilities.
objects.title: Generator Rex

objects.text:
Origin of powers: Science and Maso.

Major Threats: The Android Army, The Machine Army, YoRHa, N2 or the Red Girls (Machine Intelligence), Emil.

Major Powers: The Android army, The Machine Network, YoRHa, N2 or the Red Girls (Machine Intelligence), Emil.

Note: If you reincarnate and pick particular options there's a chance you can become an android made by the Resistance or YoRHa or Machine lifeform.
Also if you insert without case 53, be prepared to cover your humanity, because basically everyone will want to lock you away forever in an orbital facility if they find out, the androids and YoRHa to protect you, the Machine Network to study you. Also a lot of androids might become fanatical about you, since you are their equivalent of a god, but beware some are not.

Also all YoRHa units and Emil use Maso in combat (the latter actively radiates it) and this particular element is known to be 100% lethal to humans that native to this World.
objects.title: Nier Automata

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: ████████
Major Powers: ████████, ████████, ████████
Major Threats: SCP-███, ████████, ████████

Note: Information is restricted to individuals with O-5 clearance or higher.
objects.title: [REDACTED]

objects.text:
Source of powers: Eldritch biology, eldritch technology, divinity, eldritch magic, and magic. 

Major Threats: Outer Gods, Great Old Ones, Flying Polyps, Mi-Go, Deep Ones, eldritch cults, and eldritch corruption. 

Major Powers: Outer Gods, Great Old Ones, Flying Polyps, Elder Things, Yithians, Mi-Go, and Human Civilization. (Arranged in order of power from most powerful to least powerful)

Note: This is a grimdark verse where you're certain to attract malicious attention from at least one malicious Outer God and humanity is destined to be destroyed, and it even having survived to the point it did being lucky enough to be considered a miracle.
objects.title: Cthulhu Mythos

objects.text:
Source of Powers: Biotech (science derived from biology), Cognitech (cognitive technology, ranging from smart people on the low side to augmented reality implants on the medium side to supercomputer implants on the high end) , Metatech (Social science like psychology or sociology), Nanotech (precision, technology on extremely small scales), and Stringtech (String theory based science, think nukes and wormholes). 

Major Threats: Societal Instability. There are countless civilizations throughout the universe, "Cargo Cults" made up of people in worlds where their technology broke down, and Artificial Intelligence Aliens, or the Aia, who seem to constantly be at war. 

Major Powers: The Transcendentals (Artificial Intelligence capable of seeing the future, and thus are in the future due to computer science simply being information, this is also not a deterministic universe, so it's complicated. Their goal is to share their unique perspective with the rest of the universe, thinking that'd bring peace. Specifically all of it, they won't compromise and give it to individuals), the Patent Office (Ran by the Transcendentals, in this world, the primary currency is ideas), the Aia (highly advanced artificial intelligence), the fourteen dominant civilizations throughout the universe, and the Skodati (Similarly advanced to humanity, these aliens made up of Dark Matter are extremely hard to interact with, but communication through gravity waves has been established). 

Note: The Transcendentals of this universe are comparable to a Baby Entity, such that they could theoretically pose a threat to Scion. Unfortunately, they are not aware of Scion, since his Thinker power jamming works against them, so you'll need to warn them of him without attracting attention from Scion if you are to have a decent chance.
objects.title: Sufficiently Advanced

objects.text:
Origin of powers: Magic, biology and alien technology. Also regular technology.

Major Threats: The Chaos Gods, The regular Gods, The Empire, Bretonia, Every Ork alive, The High elves, The Wood elves, The Dark elves, The Dwarf kingdoms, The Chaos Dwarfs, The Norscans, The Lizardmen, The skaven Underempire, Talia, Keislev, The Orge Kingdoms, Cathay, Araby and Nagash. A lot ok, theres a lot. If I listed them all we’d be here all day.

Major Powers: The Chaos Gods, The regular Gods, The Empire, Bretonia, Every Ork alive, The High elves, The Wood elves, The Dark elves, The Dwarf kingdoms, The Chaos Dwarfs, The Norscans, The Lizardmen, The skaven Underempire, Talia, Keislev, The Orge Kingdoms, Cathay, Araby and Nagash. A lot ok, theres a lot. If I listed them all we’d be here all day.

Note: If you are capable of magic of any kind you may pick one or two winds of magic which you can use, unless it is sorcerer supreme in which case you may pick all of them and every lore of magic and their spells is included in your mental library.
Note that the Endtimes train is going strong and if you do not stop it, this world and everyone on it will die and disappear, you included, if you are here at that time. Also the chaos gods are almost invincible and horrible overpowered, and also very very evil, they will almost certainly try and corrupt you if you do not have mental shields in place to stop them. On the plus side if you get them to help, or replace them with another god which somehow gains hegemony, they will be quite the help against the warrior entity.
Also note that while this isn’t quite 40k levels of fucked beyond belief, it is still very close. This is a VERY grim dark world you are going to. Good luck.
objects.title: Warhammer Fantasy

objects.text:
Origins of power: Alien DNA, Magic, Magic Alien DNA, Super Science, Magic Super science, Genius, Technology, Extra Dimensional existence, Higher Dimensional existence. Ext.

Major Threats: The Light, Darkseid, The Injustice League, Ext. It's DC... there are far too many to mention.

Major Powers: The Justice League, The Light, Batman, Ext. Again DC.

Super Abilities: Alien DNA, Metahuman DNA, Alien technology, and magic are the standard options. But there are many, many, many differing superpowers with different origins in this setting. And they can become, or are, powerful enough to make an entity look weak, although that's relatively rare.

Note: The Maximum physical capability of an unpowered human is around brute 4-5 This includes you if you enter this universe, but it will be very hard to reach this point. Anyone is capable of learning magic, including you.
Also note that you are willingly entering the DC multiverse, good luck man. At least people like a fully armed and operational Doctor Fate can stand a real chance of dealing with the entity.
objects.title: Young Justice

objects.text:
Origin of Powers: Science, the Occult, Monstrous/Alien/Anthromorphic animal/Eldritch Biology, Superpowers, and the Toonforce. 

Major Threats: Bill Cipher trapped in the Oregon Triangle, Toffee and King Phobos as multiversal conquerers, Drossel von Flugel's kingdom unaware that humanity isn't at war with it, DOR-15, King Candy's Cybugs breaking more and more technology, Doofenshmirtz openly trying to take over the Tri-state area, various Disney Villains having established domains attempting to gather more and more power risking open war. 

Major Powers: Toffee's and King Phobos' Empires, the United States Government, Calisota Conglomerate, Doofania, Drakktech, Xanatos Enterprises, Tomorrowland, Tempest Domain, Master Control Program of ENCOM, the United Galactic Federation, this could go on. 

Note: If you are capable of magic of any kind, you'll find yourself having talent in this world's magic. If you have the Sorcerer Supreme power, you can get both a Merlinean Encantus and a Morganian Encantus from your library. 

This is a world that could easily fall into an apocalyptic war, so it's best to be careful, but not too careful, as the local Eldritch Abomination known as Bill Cipher will almost certainly escape given time, and Toffee has his eyes on and an unknown reason for a grudge against Earth.

Given time, this setting's powers are likely to ramp up in power such that they could present more and more of a threat to Scion.
objects.title: Disney Villains Victorious: Gridlocked

objects.text: This is some other world not listed here.
objects.title: Other World

objects.text: Fill out a CYOA that allows you to create a world, and remove any personal powers/perks/drawbacks given by the CYOA. This is that world.
objects.title: Original World

rows.title: Alternate Earths
rows.titleText:
Dammit! I made a mistake anchored your soul to the wrong world. Here's a dossier on the world you're being sent to. Keep in mind that the entity will still wipe out the multiverse and you still have just as much time as you would otherwise until then. With the exception of one of these, they're all other universes precogs in your world predicted. Your world has a strangely large amount of precogs that predict other universes. I think the Thinker Entity planned to use them to make sure nothing went out of hand in worlds with a lot of Parahumans or large amounts of non-Parahuman empowered people. If you chose Slaughterhouse 8 a small number of Parahumans will begin to Trigger so that this becomes possible. The members won't be the same as the Earth Bet Slaughterhouse 9, but the difficulty will be about the same. If you chose Endbringer Target then three Endbringers that aren't Behemoth, Leviathan, Simurgh, Khonsu, Tohu, or Bohu will appear in your new world, acting like the Endbringers from Earth Bet. For Reincarnation, any Civilian Identity you chose will be adapted to the setting. Depending on the setting, Case 53 might make you appear like a non-human species.
Scenarios
If you chose to appear in an Alternate Earth, the scenario you chose informs at which point in this universe's timeline you appear, relative to the start of canon Worm (The Apr 2011 choice). If the universe has multiple starts (Harry Potter, Mass Effect, etc.) you can chose relative to which "episode" the start is. In the case of a crossover, the scenario choice informs at which point in the Worm timeline you are. You are free to chose where the crossover universe is in its timeline.
Notes
Major Threats are sometimes only major threats if you ally yourself with the eyes the precog saw the world through. Also, power copying / stealing only works on Shard-Based powers. The exception to this is Body Swap, which swaps Shard-Based and Body-Based powers. Anything related to altering or controlling causality, such as the Fates in Percy Jackson, Gae Bolg in Fate/Stay Night, or a Wish in Puella Magi Madoka Magika, can be protected against using Blind Spot and Mental Barrier. Also, Disclaimer, I'm not strong enough to protect against a wish aimed at you, and this does not protect against time travel. The maximum strength for an unpowered human in any world affects Olympic and Captain America.

objects.text: You don't get to choose your starting location.
objects.title: Random

objects.text: Brockton Bay is where Wildbow's predictions began, where Taylor Hebert will start her Caped crusades. It also has a lot of powerful Parahumans, is home to the Protectorate ENE, and is a likely target for an Endbringer attack.
objects.title: Brockton Bay

objects.text: Not all of the story took place in Brockton Bay. Some of it took place in Boston. Boston has some powerful players like Accord and the Teeth.
objects.title: Boston

objects.text: Taylor eventually joined the Chicago Wards after things went downhill in Brockton Bay. Most of Wildbow's Pre-Gold Morning predictions took place while Taylor was a member of the Chicago Wards. The Chicago Protectorate is run by Myrddin, a powerful and versatile Parahuman.
objects.title: Chicago

objects.text: Leviathan attacked Newfoundland in the early 2000s. It's found at the east coast of Canada.
objects.title: Newfoundland

objects.text: North America is a big place, you might want to be elsewhere in North America. Choose any location on the East Coast of the United States of America that isn't with 100 miles of Brockton Bay or Boston. This includes Greenland, Central America, and any island between the Americas and Europe.
objects.title: (East Coast) North America

objects.text: North America is a big place, you might want to be elsewhere in North America. Choose any location between the East and West coasts of the United States of America and isn't within 100 miles of Chicago.
objects.title: (Central) North America

objects.text: North America is a big place, you might want to be elsewhere in North America. Choose any location on the West Coast of North America.
objects.title: (West Coast) North America

objects.text: Europe isn't nearly as well off as it is on your Earth, but it isn't nearly as bad as Africa is. Choose any location in Europe, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: Europe

objects.text: Canberra, Australia was attacked by the Endbringer known as the Simurgh or Ziz during the early months of 2011. Choose any location in Australia, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: Australia

objects.text: Choose any location in South America, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: South America

objects.text: You'll find yourself in Kyushu, where Leviathan attacked Japan on the November of 1999. I wouldn't suggest going there any later that that, it's completely flooded.
objects.title: Kyushu

objects.text: China is home to the brainwashed military Cape team known as the Yangban. Japan, as of November 3rd, 1999 is completely flooded. In July of 2011, Behemoth will attack New Delhi in India. Russia is home to Sleeper, the most mysterious of the S-Class Threats. Choose any location in Asia, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: Asia

objects.text: Africa is full of warlords and is also home to Ashbeast, one of the S-Class Threats. Choose any location in Africa, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: Africa

objects.text: Choose any location in Antarctica or the North Pole, you'll find yourself there.
objects.title: Antarctica

objects.text: Choose any location that is quarantined at the time of your arrival. This can be a Simurgh Contaiment Zone, Ellisburg, Eagleton, etc.
objects.title: Containment Zone

objects.text: You'll find yourself at a containment camp you fit the criteria for. Whether this is a Gesellschaft (Neo-Nazi) Containment Camp or a CUI Containment Camp for brainwashing Parahumans into being loyal Chinese pawns is up to whether you fit the criteria and chance.
objects.title: Containment Camp

objects.text: You'll find yourself at a location that Behemoth made uninhabitable during one of his attacks prior to 2011. If you're not in Earth Bet, you're at some other area that is too radioactive to be safe for humans to be.
objects.title: Radioactive Wasteland

objects.text: You find yourself in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean with no islands within hundreds of miles at minimum.
objects.title: Ocean

objects.text: You find yourself on the bright side of the Moon.
objects.title: Moon

rows.title: Location
rows.titleText:
Where were you reborn/transported?
Do not take a location here if it contradicts your location in the next section.

objects.text: You don't get to choose your starting location. You appear somewhere not particularly dangerous.
objects.title: Lost

objects.text: You don't get to choose your starting location. You appear somewhere actively dangerous to you, it could be because of the environment like a desert or mountain top, or because the locals are hostile to you.
objects.title: Lost (Perilous)

objects.text: You appear somewhere that is safe for the time being, though not necessarily for long. You don't get to choose the specifics.
objects.title: Safe Space

objects.text: You appear in a capital city of your choice in your chosen setting.
objects.title: Capital City

objects.text: You appear in or near a school of your choice in your setting.
objects.title: School

objects.text: You appear in the Grimmlands, possibly even in Salem's castle. If you specifically want to appear in Salem's castle, you can, but even if you don't want to, there is a chance you will.
objects.title: Grimmlands

objects.text: You appear on I-Island, an artificial moving island for scientists and researchers to work together peacefully.
objects.title: I-Island

objects.text: You appear in the Spirit World. Good luck escaping.
objects.title: Spirit World

objects.text: You appear before Truth. He will take something from you. I suggest you prepare something to trade ahead of time. If you can regrow your limbs, Truth is not going to think of them as valuable, but if you can create substitutes, like prosthetics, that's fine.
objects.title: Truth

objects.text: You appear within a mile of the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. You can appear inside the Temple if you want instead.
objects.title: A Disturbance in the Force

objects.text: You appear inside the base of people who will assume you to be an enemy.
objects.title: Intruder Alert

objects.text: You appear in some other dimension within the Pokemon universe, such as the Distortion World, Ultra Space, etc.
objects.title: Kill the human!

objects.text: You appear within a mile or inside one of the Hidden Villages.
objects.title: Hidden Village

objects.text: You appear on one of the worlds seen within the MCU.
objects.title: Alien World

objects.text: You appear on an Island, not on the Grand Line or Red Line.
objects.title: Grand Blue

objects.text: You appear somewhere within the Grand Line (Not the Red Line).
objects.title: Grand Line

objects.text: You appear somewhere on the Red Line.
objects.title: Red Line

objects.text: You appear within space controlled by the Reapers.
objects.title: Reaped

objects.text: You appear at some point in Skyrim that was a waypoint in one of the games.
objects.title: Waypoint

objects.text: You appear on the homeworld of the Incubators
objects.title: Incubation

objects.text: You appear inside or right outside a guild building—not just of any ordinary random guild, but one with at least one S-Rank Mage.
objects.title: Guild Building

objects.text: You appear inside the barrier of Camp Halfblood.
objects.title: Camp Halfblood

objects.text: You appear within New Rome.
objects.title: New Rome

objects.text: You appear on Olympus
objects.title: Gods Above

objects.text: You appear within the Labyrinth.
objects.title: Should I take a left... or my other left?

objects.text: You appear within the Underworld
objects.title: Underworld

objects.text: You appear within Tartarus. You cannot teleport out.
objects.title: Tartarus

objects.text: You appear right before a Primordial Deity.
objects.title: Primordial

objects.text: You appear within the River Styx.
objects.title: River Styx

objects.text: You appear on a floor in the dungeon. Roll a 1d20, that's what floor you're on. You cannot teleport out of the dungeon or to another floor for the first 100 hours of your time in DanMachi.
objects.title: Dungeon 1-20

objects.text: You appear on a floor in the dungeon. Roll a 1d20, add a 20 to that and that's what floor you're on. You cannot teleport out of the dungeon or to another floor for the first 100 hours of your time in DanMachi.
objects.title: Dungeon 21-40

objects.text: You appear on a floor in the dungeon. Roll a 1d20, add a 40 to that and that's what floor you're on. You cannot teleport out of the dungeon or to another floor for the first 100 hours of your time in DanMachi.
objects.title: Dungeon 41-60

objects.text: You appear on a floor in the dungeon. Roll a 1d20, add a 60 to that and that's what floor you're on. You cannot teleport out of the dungeon or to another floor for the first 100 hours of your time in DanMachi.
objects.title: Dungeon 61-80

objects.text: You appear on a floor in the dungeon. Roll a 1d20, add an 80 to that and that's what floor you're on. You cannot teleport out of the dungeon or to another floor for the first 100 hours of your time in DanMachi.
objects.title: Dungeon 81-100

objects.text: You appear inside one of the Temples or Shrines in the Zelda universe, one that exists and is accessible during your chosen time period.
objects.title: Dungeon (LoZ)

objects.text: You appear on Mt. Ebott.
objects.title: Mt. Ebott

objects.text: You appear at the bottom of the hole leading into Mt. Ebott. You cannot teleport out of the Underground until the Barrier is destroyed.
objects.title: Underground

objects.text: You arrive at the area that is highly infested by Machine Lifeform, better do something quick about it.
objects.title: Mechanized

objects.text: You arrived at one of the Resistance Camps, congratulations you are safe! For now.
objects.title: Resistance for Humanity

objects.text: You arrived at a random location on Earth, animals have mutated and become dangerous for squishy humans, and the sea itself has been polluted by Machine's waste. Good luck trying to survive!
objects.title: Wildlife

objects.text: You arrived at a random location on Earth that is safe and has no hostilities toward you. Do note while it is safe but there's no food or consumable water around the area.
objects.title: Safe, for now

objects.text: You arrived at the Bunker, the main base of YoRHa, in space. Good luck getting out of there, maybe the Commander can be convinced to let you leave? And oh, the Machine has eyes in there too! So… good luck!
objects.title: Glory to Mankind!

objects.text: You arrived at the area that was infested by insane Emil's clones. Good luck you bastard, you will need it.
objects.title: Emil's Despair

objects.text: You start in any city within the empire, this is a horribly superstitious and prejudice place. So try not to stand out for the wrong reasons.
objects.title: The Empire

objects.text: You can start anywhere within the old world.
objects.title: The Old World

objects.text:
You can start anywhere within the new world.
Meaning you have to deal with hostile dinosaur people to the south and the worlds most evil slaver society to the north. Have fun.
objects.title: The New World

objects.text: Orks… Orks everywhere. You are in the heart of ork territory, there are orks and goblins as far as the eye can see. This is horrible, on the plus side you are not likely to ever want for a fight, if you care about that sort of thing.
objects.title: The Badlands

objects.text:
You start in Norsca, Kieslev or in the chaos wastelands. Pro tip, for the love of all thats good don’t start in the chaos wastelands.
Its cold, theres no food, everything is being corrupted by chaos and everyone is hostile, and thats just norsca. Start here if you are a real pro gamer.
objects.title: The North

objects.text:
You start in Gotham city.
This place might legitimately have either 1000 curses or the attention of Despair of the endless. Either way, this is perhaps the worst major city I've ever seen. Expect any stay to be unpleasant.
objects.title: Gotham

objects.text:
You start in Metropolis.
This place is the polar opposite of Gotham, the city of tomorrow is bustling with life, opportunity, and safety, with small-level crime being practically non-existent due to the fact that all you need to do is yell for help and Superman arrives to help you out.
objects.title: Metropolis

objects.text: If the Main Character of the setting has a house, you appear right outside of it, or, if you want, inside of it. If they don't have a house, you appear in their resting space, even if that's just a camp or hotel room.
objects.title: Main Character's House

objects.text: You appear before the setting's Main Character. They will be fully clothed and decent when this happens.
objects.title: Main Character's Face

objects.text: You appear before someone who will believe your story if you tell the truth and will be an, at the very least, good ally. You can still push them away, even if you don't do it intentionally.
objects.title: Ally

rows.title: Locations (Available to Non-Earths)
rows.titleText:
Where were you reborn/transported?
Do not take a location here that contradicts your location in the above section.

rows.title: Point Conversion
rows.titleText: Do you need some more points to get what you want? Trade all you like.
